intro: Lessingia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it well adapted to drought conditions and harsh climates.
